snippet: The conductor assembled this work, which incorporates Verdi’s “Requiem,” to commemorate the choir that the conductor Rafael Schächter assembled at the Terezin concentration camp.
abstract: Vivien Schweitzer reviews performance by Orchestra of Terezin Remembrance and Collegiate Chorale, conducted by Murry Sidlin, at Avery Fisher Hall.
lead_paragraph: The conductor assembled this work, which incorporates Verdi’s “Requiem,” to commemorate the choir that the conductor Rafael Schächter assembled at the Terezin concentration camp.

headline.main: Murry Sidlin Conducts ‘Defiant Requiem,’ a Tribute to Defiance With Verdi
